Grassmann Graphs Are Distance-Transitive

Feb 14, 2017

In this post, my goal is to verify that every Grassmann graph is distance-transitive.

Suppose that we are given arbitrary natural number , a natural number , and a prime power . Let denote the set of -dimensional subspaces of a vector space over the finite field of order . Consider the simple graph formed with the set as vertices and the set as edges. Then:

  1. Suppose that is a linear isomorphism.

    Now, note that , , and - since on .

    This means here that it is possible to construct a linear isomorphism such that , , , and .

    By 1., this implies that there is an automorphism such that and , where for all .

    Hence is distance-transitive, since and are arbitrary.

By 1. and 2., it follows that Grassmann graphs are distance-transitive in general.
